info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 17 at 8:45PM CDT until June 21 at 2:17AM CDT by NWS Wichita KS
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kansas...
Neosho River near Chanute affecting Allen and Neosho Counties.
Neosho River near Parsons affecting Labette and Neosho Counties.
Neosho River near Erie affecting Neosho County.
Neosho River at Oswego affecting Cherokee and Labette Counties.
Neosho River at Iola affecting Allen County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Neosho River near Chanute.
* WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon to early Saturday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 25.5 feet, Flooding occurs along 800 Street from Patrolia down to Chanute. Also 3/4 of a mile east of Chanute, Dump Road floods.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 17.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 27.0 feet Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don't drown.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 845 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON TO EARLY SATURDAY MORNING
